results.title: Please don't pick the daisies
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
The Snowy Mountains of South East Australia, despite their rugged, unchanging appearance are, in reality, quite fragile and quite sensitive to the forces of nature and the presence of people. The wild beauty of Kosciusko’s alpine flora is recorded by a research team for a new book.

results.title: Please don't leave me
results.creator_credit: Robin Hughes, Film Australia and Stephen Ramsey
results.brief_description: Shows through examples, how young children can be prepared for the experience of going into hospital alone. Photographers, Tony Wilson, Dean Semler; editor, Nick Torrens; sound, Jeff Doring, Brian Morris, Tim Lloyd.

results.title: Please can I come tomorrow? (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A child is not born with a comprehension of miracles. Education should be tailored to his level of comprehension - his experiences with play and people. This film examines nursery school in some depth to see how a child in particular and society as a whole can benefit from them.

results.title: Plaza = The Beach
results.creator_credit: Andrzej Jozwikiewicz, Studio Malych Form Filmowych Se-Ma-For and Edward Sturlis
results.brief_description: Two cheeky tattoos escape from the chests of two sailors to wreak havoc on unsuspecting sunbathers, returning when the pace of their pranks gets out of hand. A comic short film, effectively combining real life with animation.

results.title: Playing with numbers (TEFC)
results.brief_description: The main part of this program concerns an examination of the types of numbers that arise. Rational numbers, algebraic numbers and irrational numbers are illustrated and discussed.

results.title: Playing with fire
results.creator_credit: Christopher Knight, National Fire Protection Association. Public Affairs Division and Frank Cantor
results.brief_description: Two children take some matches from home and set fire to a truck, which in the process of exploding burns them both badly. A doctor explains that dangers should be explained to children as so often in the domestic situation children are put at risk when with care and commonsense these can be avoided.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christopher Knight, National Fire Protection Association. Public Affairs Division and Frank Cantor
